
### On LEA 


* LEA = Load Effective Address
* uses the syntax of a memory access, butâ€¦
* just computes the address and uses it:
* `leaq 4(%rax), %rax` same as `addq $4, %rax` 

   * almost --- doesn't set condition codes



### LEA tricks 


* `leaq (%rax,%rax,4), %rax` multiplies <code>%rax</code> by 5 

   * <code>address-of(memory[rax + rax * 4])</code>

* `leal (%rbx,%rcx), %eax` adds rbx + rcx into eax 

   * ignores top 64-bits
